edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions

Class WapException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.exceptions.WapException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContainerNotEmptyException, EtagDoesntMatchException, FormatException, FormatNotAvailableException, HttpHeaderException, IllegalHttpParameterException, IllegalPageIriException, InternalServerException, InvalidContainerException, InvalidRequestException, MethodNotAllowedException, NotAContainerException, NotAnAnnotationException, NotExistentException, RepositoryException, ResourceDeletedException, ResourceExistsException, UnallowedPropertyChangeException

    public abstract class WapException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    The base exception class use for all Web Annotation Protocol Server specific exceptions.

    Subclasses must provide a HTTP Status Code value to use for HTTP Responses caused by this exception.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • WapException

        public WapException(java.lang.String message,
                    int httpStatusCode,
                    java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs a new WapException with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        message - The message used for the exception
        httpStatusCode - The HTTP Status Code to use
        cause - the cause. (A NULL value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

      • WapException

        public WapException(java.lang.String message,
                    int httpStatusCode,
                    java.lang.Throwable cause,
                    boolean enableSuppression,
                    boolean writableStackTrace)
        Constructs a new WapException with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        message - The message used for the exception
        httpStatusCode - The HTTP Status Code to use
        cause - the cause. (A NULL value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)
        enableSuppression - whether or not suppression is enabled or disabled
        writableStackTrace - whether or not the stack trace should be writable
